intro: Aethusa cynapium var. elata, commonly known as giant cowparsnip, is a tall biennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbrella-shaped inflorescence and finely divided leaves. The plant can grow up to 2 meters in height, with hollow, ridged stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in compound umbels, and it produces small, smooth fruits. The plant is often found in moist meadows, stream banks, and other damp habitats.
